6 MulticamOdometer::MulticamOdometer(ros::NodeHandle node): node_(node)
7 {

9  node_.param<int>("param_odometerMinNumberMatches", param_odometerMinNumberMatches_, 20);
10  node_.param<int>("param_odometerRansacIters", param_odometerRansacIters_, 400);

37 Eigen::Matrix4f MulticamOdometer::estimateMotion(std::vector<std::vector<Match>> matches, int numCameras, std::vector<image_geometry::PinholeCameraModel> intrinsics)
38 {
39  // fundamental matrix, rotation and translation obtained with the correspondences between each combination of cameras
40  std::vector<Eigen::Matrix3f> testFs(3*numCameras, Eigen::Matrix3f::Zero());
41  std::vector<Eigen::Matrix3f> R;
42  std::vector<Eigen::Vector3f> t;
43 
44  // flags indicating whether R,t was successfully obtained or not
45  std::vector<bool> success(3*numCameras, false);
46 
47  // vectors with the rotation matrices / translation vectors generated by all intra- and consecutive inter-camera matches
48  R.resize(3 * numCameras);
49  t.resize(3 * numCameras);
50 
51  // compute rotation and translation for each set of intra- and consecutive inter-camera matches
52  for(int i=0; i<3*numCameras; i++)
53  {
54  // get camera indexes of the cameras of the current and previous frames
55  int camNoPrev = i/3;
56  int camNoCurr;
57  if(i%3 == 1)
58  {
59  int aux;
60  getLeftRightCameras(camNoPrev, aux, camNoCurr);
61  }
62  else if(i%3 == 2)
63  {
64  int aux;
65  getLeftRightCameras(camNoPrev, camNoCurr, aux);
66  }
67  else
68  {
69  camNoCurr = camNoPrev;
70  }
71 
72  // check number of correspondences
73  int N = matches[i].size();
74  if(N < param_odometerMinNumberMatches_)
75  {
76  // too few matches to compute F
77  continue;
78  }
79 
80  // get intrinsic matrices K
81  Eigen::Matrix3f KPrev, KCurr;
82  KPrev << intrinsics[camNoPrev].fx(), 0.0, intrinsics[camNoPrev].cx(), 0.0, intrinsics[camNoPrev].fy(), intrinsics[camNoPrev].cy(), 0.0, 0.0, 1.0;
83  KCurr << intrinsics[camNoCurr].fx(), 0.0, intrinsics[camNoCurr].cx(), 0.0, intrinsics[camNoCurr].fy(), intrinsics[camNoCurr].cy(), 0.0, 0.0, 1.0;
84 
85  // normalize 2D features
86  Eigen::Matrix3f NormTPrev, NormTCurr;
87  std::vector<Match> matchesNorm = normalize2DPoints(matches[i], NormTPrev, NormTCurr);
88 
89  Eigen::Matrix3f F, E;
90  std::vector<int> inlierIndices;
91  // RANSAC
92  for(int j=0; j<param_odometerRansacIters_; j++)
93  {
94  // get random sample
95  std::vector<int> chosenIndices = getRandomSample(matchesNorm.size(), 8);
96 
97  // compute fundamental matrix
98  F = getFundamentalMatrix(matchesNorm, chosenIndices);
99 
100  // get inliers
101  std::vector<int> inlierIndicesCurr = getInliers(matchesNorm, F);
102 
103  if(inlierIndicesCurr.size() > inlierIndices.size())
104  {
105  inlierIndices = inlierIndicesCurr;
106  }
107  }
108 
109  // check number of inliers
110  if(inlierIndices.size() < param_odometerMinNumberMatches_)
111  {
112  continue;
113  }
114 
115  // compute fundamental matrix out of all inliers
116  F = getFundamentalMatrix(matchesNorm, inlierIndices);
117 
118  // store fundamental matrix F
119  testFs[i] = F;
120 
121  // denormalize F
122  F = NormTCurr.transpose() * F * NormTPrev;
123 
124  // compute essential matrix E
125  E = F2E(F, KPrev, KCurr);
126 
127  // get rotation and translation and triangulate points
128  Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, Eigen::Dynamic> points3D;
129  EtoRt(E, KPrev, KCurr, matches[i], R[i], t[i], points3D);
130 
131  // normalize 3D points (force last coordinate to 0)
132  std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> valid3DPoints;
133  for(int j=0; j<points3D.cols(); j++)
134  {
135  Eigen::Vector4f pt = points3D.block<4, 1>(0, j);
136  pt = pt / pt(3);
137  if(pt(2) > 0)
138  {
139  valid3DPoints.push_back(pt);
140  }
141  }
142 
143  // check number of valid points
144  if(valid3DPoints.size() < param_odometerMinNumberMatches_)
145  {
146  continue;
147  }
148 
149  // discard far-away points (i.e., that are more distant than the median)
150  double median;
151  std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> close3DPoints = getClosePoints(valid3DPoints, median);
152 
153  // if big median (small motion), return error
154  if(median > param_odometerMotionThreshold_)
155  {
156  continue;
157  }
158 
159  success[i] = true;
160 
161  // adjust translation scale
162  //double scale = getTranslationScale(close3DPoints, median, param_cameraPitch_[i/3], param_cameraHeight_);
163  //t[i] = t[i] * scale;
164 
165  }
166 
167 
168  // find out which R,t gets the most inliers from ALL matches
169  int maxInliers = 0;
170  int bestCamera = 0;
171  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
172  {
173  int sumInliers = 0;
174  // if R,t were successfully obtained...
175  if(success[i])
176  {
177  std::cout << "K"; std::cout.flush();
178 
179  // count number of inliers from all sets of matches (i.e., all intra- and consecutive inter-camera matches)
180  for(int j=0; j<matches.size(); j++)
181  {
182  if(success[j])
183  {
184  std::vector<int> inlIdxs = getInliers(matches[j], testFs[i]);
185  sumInliers += inlIdxs.size();
186  //std::cout << "F(" << i << ") -> inliers in cam. " << j << ": " << inlIdxs.size() << std::endl;
187  }
188  }
189  if(sumInliers > maxInliers)
190  {
191  maxInliers = sumInliers;
192  bestCamera = i;
193  }
194  }
195  else
196  {
197  std::cout << "."; std::cout.flush();
198  }
199  }
200  std::cout << std::endl;
201 
202  // build tranformation matrix with the winner R,t and return
203  Eigen::Matrix4f T;
204  T << R[bestCamera](0, 0), R[bestCamera](0, 1), R[bestCamera](0, 2), t[bestCamera](0), R[bestCamera](1, 0), R[bestCamera](1, 1), R[bestCamera](1, 2), t[bestCamera](1), R[bestCamera](2, 0), R[bestCamera](2, 1), R[bestCamera](2, 2), t[bestCamera](2), 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0;
205 
206  // transform to front camera (0) coordinates
207  /*Eigen::Matrix4f cam0Ext = transform2ExtrinsicsVector(param_extrinsicsCam0_);
208  Eigen::Matrix4f cam1Ext = transform2ExtrinsicsVector(param_extrinsicsCam1_);
209  Eigen::Matrix4f cam2Ext = transform2ExtrinsicsVector(param_extrinsicsCam2_);
210  Eigen::Matrix4f cam3Ext = transform2ExtrinsicsVector(param_extrinsicsCam3_);
211  Eigen::Matrix4f cam4Ext = transform2ExtrinsicsVector(param_extrinsicsCam4_);*/
212 
213  return T;
214 }
215 
221 std::vector<Match> MulticamOdometer::normalize2DPoints(std::vector<Match> matches, Eigen::Matrix3f &NormTPrev, Eigen::Matrix3f &NormTCurr)
222 {
223  std::vector<cv::KeyPoint> keypointsPrev, keypointsCurr;
224  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
225  {
226  cv::KeyPoint kpPrev = matches[i].getFirstFeature().getKeypoint();
227  cv::KeyPoint kpCurr = matches[i].getSecondFeature().getKeypoint();
228  keypointsPrev.push_back(kpPrev);
229  keypointsCurr.push_back(kpCurr);
230  }
231 
232  // compute centroids of all features from the previous and current frames separately
233  cv::Point2f sumPrev = cv::Point2f(0.0, 0.0);
234  cv::Point2f sumCurr = cv::Point2f(0.0, 0.0);
235  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
236  {
237  sumPrev += keypointsPrev[i].pt;
238  sumCurr += keypointsCurr[i].pt;
239  }
240  sumPrev.x /= matches.size();
241  sumPrev.y /= matches.size();
242  sumCurr.x /= matches.size();
243  sumCurr.y /= matches.size();
244 
245  // subtract feature points by the corresponding centroid
246  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
247  {
248  keypointsPrev[i].pt = keypointsPrev[i].pt - sumPrev;
249  keypointsCurr[i].pt = keypointsCurr[i].pt - sumCurr;
250  }
251 
252  // multiplicate points by a scale factor, so that the average distance to the origin is sqrt(2)
253  double scalePrev = 0.0;
254  double scaleCurr = 0.0;
255  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
256  {
257  cv::Point2f pt1 = keypointsPrev[i].pt;
258  cv::Point2f pt2 = keypointsCurr[i].pt;
259  scalePrev += sqrt(pt1.x * pt1.x + pt1.y * pt1.y);
260  scaleCurr += sqrt(pt2.x * pt2.x + pt2.y * pt2.y);
261  }
262 
263  scalePrev = sqrt(2) * matches.size() / scalePrev;
264  scaleCurr = sqrt(2) * matches.size() / scaleCurr;
265 
266  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
267  {
268  cv::Point2f pt1 = keypointsPrev[i].pt;
269  cv::Point2f pt2 = keypointsCurr[i].pt;
270  keypointsPrev[i].pt = scalePrev * pt1;
271  keypointsCurr[i].pt = scaleCurr * pt2;
272 
273  Feature f1(matches[i].getFirstFeature());
274  f1.setKeypoint(keypointsPrev[i]);
275 
276  Feature f2(matches[i].getSecondFeature());
277  f2.setKeypoint(keypointsCurr[i]);
278 
279  Match m(f1, f2, matches[i].getDistance());
280  m.setColor(matches[i].getColor());
281  matches[i] = m;
282  }
283 
284  // build normalization matrices of the previous and current frames
285  NormTPrev << scalePrev, 0.0, -scalePrev*sumPrev.x, 0.0, scalePrev, -scalePrev*sumPrev.y, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0;
286  NormTCurr << scaleCurr, 0.0, -scaleCurr*sumCurr.x, 0.0, scaleCurr, -scaleCurr*sumCurr.y, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0;
287 
288  return matches;
289 }
290 
295 std::vector<int> MulticamOdometer::getRandomSample(int totalNumber, int sampleSize)
296 {
297  std::vector<int> randomSample;
298  for(int i=0; i<sampleSize; i++)
299  {
300  // if the randomly selected number is in the vector, select another one
301  int x = rand()%totalNumber;
302  while(elemInVec(randomSample, x))
303  {
304  x = rand()%totalNumber;
305  }
306  randomSample.push_back(x);
307  }
308  return randomSample;
309 }
310 
315 bool MulticamOdometer::elemInVec(std::vector<int> vec, int x)
316 {
317  for(int i=0; i<vec.size(); i++)
318  {
319  if(vec[i] == x)
320  {
321  return true;
322  }
323  }
324  return false;
325 }
326 
331 Eigen::Matrix3f MulticamOdometer::getFundamentalMatrix(std::vector<Match> matches, std::vector<int> indices)
332 {
333  // see Trucco & Verri, Introductory Techniques for 3D Computer Vision, chapter 6
334  Eigen::Matrix<float, 8, 9> A;
335  for(int i=0; i<8; i++)
336  {
337  cv::Point2f pPrev = matches[indices[i]].getFirstFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
338  cv::Point2f pCurr = matches[indices[i]].getSecondFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
339 
340  A(i, 0) = pCurr.x * pPrev.x;
341  A(i, 1) = pCurr.x * pPrev.y;
342  A(i, 2) = pCurr.x;
343  A(i, 3) = pCurr.y * pPrev.x;
344  A(i, 4) = pCurr.y * pPrev.y;
345  A(i, 5) = pCurr.y;
346  A(i, 6) = pPrev.x;
347  A(i, 7) = pPrev.y;
348  A(i, 8) = 1;
349  }
350 
351  Eigen::Matrix<float, 8, 8> U;
352  Eigen::Matrix<float, 8, 9> W;
353  Eigen::Matrix<float, 9, 9> V;
354 
355  Eigen::JacobiSVD<Eigen::Matrix<float, 8, 9>> svdA(A, Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV);
356 
357  Eigen::Matrix3f F;
358  F << svdA.matrixV()(0, 8), svdA.matrixV()(1, 8), svdA.matrixV()(2, 8), svdA.matrixV()(3, 8), svdA.matrixV()(4, 8), svdA.matrixV()(5, 8), svdA.matrixV()(6, 8), svdA.matrixV()(7, 8), svdA.matrixV()(8, 8);
359 
360  // re-enforce rank 2 constraint on fundamental matrix
361  Eigen::JacobiSVD<Eigen::Matrix3f> svdF(F, Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV);
362  Eigen::Matrix3f D(Eigen::Matrix3f::Zero());
363  D(0, 0) = svdF.singularValues()(0);
364  D(1, 1) = svdF.singularValues()(1);
365 
366  F = (svdF.matrixU()) * D * (svdF.matrixV()).transpose();
367 
368  return F;
369 }
370 
375 std::vector<int> MulticamOdometer::getInliers(std::vector<Match> matches, Eigen::Matrix3f F)
376 {
377  std::vector<int> inlierIndices;
378 
379  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
380  {
381  cv::Point2f pPrev = matches[i].getFirstFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
382  cv::Point2f pCurr = matches[i].getSecondFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
383  Eigen::Vector3f pPrevHomog, pCurrHomog;
384  pPrevHomog << pPrev.x, pPrev.y, 1.0;
385  pCurrHomog << pCurr.x, pCurr.y, 1.0;
386 
387  // xCurr^T * F * xPrev
388  double x2tFx1 = pCurrHomog.transpose() * F * pPrevHomog;
389 
390  // F * xPrev
391  Eigen::Vector3f Fx1 = F * pPrevHomog;
392 
393  // F^T * xCurr
394  Eigen::Vector3f Ftx2 = F.transpose() * pCurrHomog;
395 
396  // compute Sampson distance (distance to epipolar line)
397  double dSampson = (x2tFx1 * x2tFx1) / ((Fx1(0)*Fx1(0)) + (Fx1(1)*Fx1(1)) + (Ftx2(0)*Ftx2(0)) + (Ftx2(1)*Ftx2(1)));
398 
399  if(dSampson < param_odometerInlierThreshold_)
400  {
401  inlierIndices.push_back(i);
402  }
403  }
404  return inlierIndices;
405 }
406 
412 Eigen::Matrix3f MulticamOdometer::F2E(Eigen::Matrix3f F, Eigen::Matrix3f KPrev, Eigen::Matrix3f KCurr)
413 {
414  // multiply fundamental matrix by intrinsic matrices to obtain essential matrix
415  Eigen::Matrix3f E = KCurr.transpose() * F * KPrev;
416 
417  // re-enforce rank 2 constraint on essential matrix
418  Eigen::JacobiSVD<Eigen::Matrix3f> svdE(E, Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV);
419  Eigen::Matrix3f D(Eigen::Matrix3f::Zero());
420  D(0, 0) = svdE.singularValues()(0);
421  D(1, 1) = svdE.singularValues()(1);
422 
423  E = (svdE.matrixU()) * D * (svdE.matrixV()).transpose();
424  return E;
425 }
426 
436 void MulticamOdometer::EtoRt(Eigen::Matrix3f E, Eigen::Matrix3f KPrev, Eigen::Matrix3f KCurr, std::vector<Match> matches, Eigen::Matrix3f &R, Eigen::Vector3f &t, Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, Eigen::Dynamic> &points3D)
437 {
438  Eigen::Matrix3f W, Z;
439  W << 0, -1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1;
440  Z << 0, 1, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0;
441 
442  // singular values decomposition of E
443  Eigen::JacobiSVD<Eigen::Matrix3f> svdE(E, Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV);
444 
445  // get skew symmetric matrix of translation vector
446  Eigen::Matrix3f t_X = svdE.matrixU() * Z * (svdE.matrixU()).transpose();
447 
448  // get possible rotation matrices
449  Eigen::Matrix3f Ra = svdE.matrixU() * W * (svdE.matrixV()).transpose();
450  Eigen::Matrix3f Rb = svdE.matrixU() * W.transpose() * (svdE.matrixV()).transpose();
451 
452  // get translation vetor from skew symmetric matrix
453  t << t_X(2, 1), t_X(0, 2), t_X(1, 0);
454 
455  // correct signal of both rotation matrices
456  if(Ra.determinant() < 0)
457  {
458  Ra = -Ra;
459  }
460  if(Rb.determinant() < 0)
461  {
462  Rb = -Rb;
463  }
464 
465  // 4 possible combinations of R,t
466  std::vector<Eigen::Matrix3f> solutionsR;
467  std::vector<Eigen::Vector3f> solutionst;
468  solutionsR.push_back(Ra); solutionst.push_back(t);
469  solutionsR.push_back(Ra); solutionst.push_back(-t);
470  solutionsR.push_back(Rb); solutionst.push_back(t);
471  solutionsR.push_back(Rb); solutionst.push_back(-t);
472 
473  // test Chirality constraint for all 4 solutions
474  Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, Eigen::Dynamic> points3DCurr;
475  int maxInliers = 0;
476  for(int i=0; i<4; i++)
477  {
478  int nInliers = triangulate(matches, KPrev, KCurr, solutionsR[i], solutionst[i], points3DCurr);
479 
480  // solution with the most inliers wins
481  if(nInliers > maxInliers)
482  {
483  maxInliers = nInliers;
484  points3D = points3DCurr;
485  R = solutionsR[i];
486  t = solutionst[i];
487  }
488  }
489 }
490 
499 int MulticamOdometer::triangulate(std::vector<Match> matches, Eigen::Matrix3f KPrev, Eigen::Matrix3f KCurr, Eigen::Matrix3f R, Eigen::Vector3f t, Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, Eigen::Dynamic> &points3D)
500 {
501  points3D.resize(4, matches.size());
502 
503  // get projection matrices
504  // previous camera has identity rotation and translation
505  // current camera has rotation R and translation t
506  Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 4> projMatrixPrev = getProjectionMatrix(KPrev, Eigen::Matrix3f::Identity(), Eigen::Vector3f::Zero());
507  Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 4> projMatrixCurr = getProjectionMatrix(KCurr, R, t);
508 
509  // triangulation by orthogonal regression
510  Eigen::Matrix4f J;
511  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
512  {
513  cv::Point2f pPrev = matches[i].getFirstFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
514  cv::Point2f pCurr = matches[i].getSecondFeature().getKeypoint().pt;
515 
516  for(int j=0; j<4; j++)
517  {
518  J(0, j) = projMatrixPrev(2, j) * pPrev.x - projMatrixPrev(0, j);
519  J(1, j) = projMatrixPrev(2, j) * pPrev.y - projMatrixPrev(1, j);
520  J(2, j) = projMatrixCurr(2, j) * pCurr.x - projMatrixCurr(0, j);
521  J(3, j) = projMatrixCurr(2, j) * pCurr.y - projMatrixCurr(1, j);
522  }
523 
524  Eigen::JacobiSVD<Eigen::Matrix4f> svdJ(J, Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV);
525 
526  points3D(0, i) = svdJ.matrixV()(0, 3);
527  points3D(1, i) = svdJ.matrixV()(1, 3);
528  points3D(2, i) = svdJ.matrixV()(2, 3);
529  points3D(3, i) = svdJ.matrixV()(3, 3);
530  }
531 
532  // get reprojection points
533  Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, Eigen::Dynamic> p2DPrev, p2DCurr;
534  p2DPrev.resize(3, matches.size());
535  p2DCurr.resize(3, matches.size());
536  p2DPrev = projMatrixPrev * points3D;
537  p2DCurr = projMatrixCurr * points3D;
538 
539  // test Chirality constraint and count number of inliers
540  int inlierCounter = 0;
541  for(int i=0; i<matches.size(); i++)
542  {
543  if(p2DPrev(2, i) * points3D(3, i) > 0 && p2DCurr(2, i) * points3D(3, i) > 0)
544  {
545  inlierCounter++;
546  }
547  }
548 
549  return inlierCounter;
550 }
551 
557 Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 4> MulticamOdometer::getProjectionMatrix(Eigen::Matrix3f K, Eigen::Matrix3f R, Eigen::Vector3f t)
558 {
559  Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 4> P;
560 
561  P << R(0, 0), R(0, 1), R(0, 2), t(0), R(1, 0), R(1, 1), R(1, 2), t(1), R(2, 0), R(2, 1), R(2, 2), t(2);
562 
563  P = K * P;
564 
565  return P;
566 }
567 
572 std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> MulticamOdometer::getClosePoints(std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> points, double &median)
573 {
574  // compute distance of all points from the camera's optical center
575  std::vector<double> distances;
576  std::vector<int> indexes;
577  for(int i=0; i<points.size(); i++)
578  {
579  double d = fabs(points[i](0)) + fabs(points[i](1)) + fabs(points[i](2));
580  distances.push_back(d);
581  indexes.push_back(i);
582  }
583 
584  // sort distances and indexes vectors by the points' distances
585  for(int i=0; i<distances.size(); i++)
586  {
587  for(int j=i+1; j<distances.size(); j++)
588  {
589  if(distances[j] < distances[i])
590  {
591  double dAux = distances[i];
592  distances[i] = distances[j];
593  distances[j] = dAux;
594 
595  int iAux = indexes[i];
596  indexes[i] = indexes[j];
597  indexes[j] = iAux;
598  }
599  }
600  }
601 
602  // get median distance
603  median = distances[distances.size()/2];
604 
605  // return points with a distance below median
606  std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> close3DPoints;
607  for(int i=0; i<distances.size()/2 + 1; i++)
608  {
609  close3DPoints.push_back(points[indexes[i]]);
610  }
611 
612  return close3DPoints;
613 }
614 
621 double MulticamOdometer::getTranslationScale(std::vector<Eigen::Vector4f> points3D, double median, double pitch, double height)
622 {
623  double sigma = median/50.0;
624  double weight = 1.0/(2.0*sigma*sigma);
625 
626  // ds stores the height of all points from the ground (?)
627  std::vector<Eigen::Vector2f> pointsPlane;
628  std::vector<double> ds;
629  Eigen::Vector2f inclination;
630  inclination(0) = cos(-pitch);
631  inclination(1) = sin(-pitch);
632  for(int i=0; i<points3D.size(); i++)
633  {
634  double d = inclination.transpose() * points3D[i].segment<2>(1);
635  ds.push_back(d);
636  }
637 
638  int bestIndex = 0;
639  double maxSum = 0.0;
640 
641  for(int i=0; i<points3D.size(); i++)
642  {
643  if(ds[i] > median / param_odometerMotionThreshold_)
644  {
645  double sum = 0.0;
646  for(int j=0; j<points3D.size(); j++)
647  {
648  double dist = ds[j] - ds[i];
649  sum += exp(-dist*dist*weight);
650  }
651  if(sum > maxSum)
652  {
653  maxSum = sum;
654  bestIndex = i;
655  }
656  }
657  }
658 
659  double scale = height / ds[bestIndex];
660  return scale;
661 }
662 
666 /*Eigen::Matrix4f transform2ExtrinsicsVector(std::vector<double> extrinsics)
667 {
668  // get rotation matrix
669  double rx = extrinsics[0];
670  double ry = extrinsics[1];
671  double rz = extrinsics[2];
672  Eigen::Matrix3f Rx, Ry, Rz;
673  Rx << 1, 0, 0, 0, cos(rx), -sin(rx), 0, sin(rx), cos(rx);
674  Ry << cos(ry), 0, sin(ry), 0, 1, 0, -sin(ry), 0, cos(ry);
675  Rz << cos(rz), -sin(rz), 0, sin(rz), cos(rz), 0, 0, 0, 1;
676 
677  Eigen::Matrix3f R = Rz * Ry * Rx;
678 
679  // get translation vector
680  Eigen::Vector3f t;
681  t << extrinsics[3], extrinsics[4], extrinsics[5];
682 
683  // get transform
684  Eigen::Matrix4f T;
685  T << R(0, 0), R(0, 1), R(0, 2), t(0), R(1, 0), R(1, 1), R(1, 2), t(1), R(2, 0), R(2, 1), R(2, 2), t(2), 0, 0, 0, 1;
686  return T;
687 }*/
